Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but very close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Courtneylogic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europa for 2 nights while travelling throughout Europe. My sister and I chose the hotel because it was close to Termini stations (5 minute walk) which was convenient for sightseeing. The staff on arrival were friendly, even helping us with our oversized backpacks, but their English was a little rusty (I understand I should expect everyone to speak English in Europe). Our room was what we needed for 2 nights - clean and with a comfy bed. It certainly wasn't anything special, actually a little small and we did have a trouble trying to get the key into the door each time (staff wern't very helpful with this). The hotel does have a lift but it was old, small and really slow so it was faster to climb up and down the stairs. The lady at reception was able to provide us with a map of Rome and directions to the nearest internet cafe (hotel internet charges were expensive and receptionist actually suggested internet cafe instead). It didnt feel too safe walking from Termini in the evenings, but it it only a quick walk and the streets are well lit. Upon check-out the staff were kind enough to hold our luggage for us until we returned from sightseeing and before jumping on the train to southern Italy. While this hotel is nothing flash, it was convenient and well priced for us budget-travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Loubuen
Reviews.Content: We had a room reserved at Hotel Select Garden but were told we were changed hotel due to some air conditioning problems. We then walked to Hotel Europa (not too far). We got a very small room with a 1 1/2 bed. Since we found that bed way too small for 2 people for a whole week, we asked to be changed to a room with a bigger bed. We finally got a bigger room with a bigger comfortable bed and a nice bathroom which we found clean and full of toiletries.. The breakfast was very good and we could ask for cappuccino. There was a market every morning just outside our windows where we bought a few things. The hotel is close to termini where you can take the subway to go across town and the train to go to the airport. We felt safe at night (we were 2 couples) and did a lot of walking all over the place. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: TinksA13
Reviews.Content: Spent a fantastic 3 days in Rome based in this clean, quiet and friendly hotel. The room was small but adequate, but you really do only need a room big enough to sleep and shower in as there is so much to do and see in Rome, dont waste it in your hotel! Buffet breakfast was varied and fresh. Friendly and helpful staff, especially where parking is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff I've seen in Italy”
Reviews.Author: KristineGarina
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying at this hotel, very short stay, just 2 nights, but I have to say this is probably the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered (especially taking into account that Rome is generally not very service-oriented city to say the least...). The room was kinda small and there were some other minor things wrong, but all in all due to helpfulness and niceness of the hotel staff (reception, bar) my stay was extremely nice! If you are looking for a hotel near Termini, I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the negative reviws”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Please don’t make an opinion about The Europa Hotel based on some of the negative reviews that have been written on this site.. I don’t know which hotel they were writing the negative reviews about but it was not The Europa Hotel on the Via Varese in Rome. My wife and I just spent a fantastic 3 days in Rome at the beginning of October 2011 staying at The Europa Hotel. Check in was very smooth and handled by Roberto who was very pleasant and willing to answer all our questions, in fact all the staff members were friendly and helpful, we also thought it was a very professional to see all the cleaning staff wearing uniforms.. Our room was not as big as North American hotels but large enough for us, we are in Europe. The bathroom was beautiful and very clean with lots of towels and a good supply of toiletries. We were on the first floor at the front of the hotel so we did not have to use the elevator and we normally carry our own bags.. The windows in the room were new so there was no noise from the street. The room had air conditioning and a mini bar you could store a few drinks. I like ice with my drinks all I had to do was ask and within a few minutes I had a bowl of ice. The breakfast room was a big surprise……it was just beautiful and the selection of food was one of the best we had during our 17 day trip. As an added bonus the hotel has unlimited fast internet in the bar area. The location is great, only 2 short blocks from the Via Marsalla side of the Termini rail station. We felt very safe walking in the area at night, there is a mixture of hotels apartments and restaurants so there was always people walking around. This is a great base location to see the sights of rome with the metro, local buses and hop on hop of buses only a short 2 blocks away. Please take time to look at my pictures, they will tell the real story. Thank you Roberto and all the staff at The Europa Hotel, you made our trip to Rome so much more enjoyable. We will be staying here on our next trip to your beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “The Value is not worth the compromise”
Reviews.Author: Valerie D
Reviews.Content: Close to the station..The beds are awful, the service is barely existent. The clerk at the desks says hes alone so you need to bring up your own bags. The A/C does not work. There are no way to keep food or water in the room. No restaurant, no room service and did I mention they are unfriendly. Spend the extra money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star”
Reviews.Author: BonnieMax
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a mystery deal through the Wotif.com website. After I booked it and the hotel was revealed to me I read the reviews. I could see why this was a mystery hotel, because you would never stay here on their reviews. Wotif classed this hotel as a 4 star hotel, I’m not sure how they rate them, but it must not be for style and luxury. This hotel would be nothing more than a 2 star hotel and if that is what you are expecting, it is not that bad. It is close to the main train station, but on the wrong side for most things. We stayed in room 19 on the ground floor, it was large clean, dated and basic. I booked a double room and got 2 single beds.The staff was friendly enough and the free Wifi was a bonus. There are plenty of restaurants and a launderette close by. I would not stay here again, because I thought I was booking a 4 star hotel. This is probably the last time I use Wotif.

Reviews.Title: “Good value / location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleTYL
Reviews.Content: from Roma termini, look for Cafe Trombetta. Its about 8 mins walk from the station with luggage. Furnishings in the room is old but clean. Bathroom is spacious. Toilet flush cover kept dropping but fixable. Curtains in the bathroom were quite translucent though. Would be happy to stay there again as the street was very quiet but felt very safe at nights. Didn't use airconditioning as the weather was cool. There is a lift, but you have to walk up a short flight of steps with your suitcase before you reach the lift landing.

Reviews.Title: “No No No”
Reviews.Author: TravellersUs
Reviews.Content: This was the start to our first holiday in Rome and it was AWFUL. It was an easy walk from Termini with our luggage. There is a lift to your floor. The room was terrible. The walls were dirty. The furnishings were old and needed to be thrown out. The airconditioning was useless. The ensuite door was literally falling apart. The bed was like rock. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The room was TINY. Wi-fi only worked downstairs in the bar area. Breakfast was an extra charge, so we passed on it. We booked the room on Wotif.com and it was supposed to be 4 star....NOT!!! It was a horrible experience that we would not want anyone else to have. Definately give this place a miss!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price + great location, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Swanchan
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 20 and we stayed there 2 nights after our Mediterranean cruise. My room was on the main floor with 2 twin beds; the bed was a bit hard but it suite me well. We had our own bathroom with a shower. It's not a fancy hotel, but it is a great hotel for buget traveller. It's a few mins walk from the main Termini, and there is a supermarket, fast foods, shopping all in one place. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful, gave us good direction and even helped us to arrange taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not our first choice”
Reviews.Author: JanoMontreal
Reviews.Content: We had a room reserved at Hotel Select Garden since April, fully paid. I reconfirmed my reservation in May after I read about the over-booking in that hotel. Upon arrival at Hotel Select, I was advised that the hotel was doing some ‘’renovations’’ and that the air conditioned did not work, and that my reservation had been moved to their 'other hotel' down the street: Hotel Europa. We were not very pleased with the change. When we reached the Hotel Europa, they gave a small room with a ‘’french’’ bed (one and a half bed) but we asked to change room to a double bed which was what we had reserved at Hotel Select. Even though they were not very pleased with our request, they gave us a bigger room on the first floor with a double bed. Finally, our stay was OK. The hotel was well located, near Termini, the room was clean, the bathroom was big enough and the breakfast was complete (eggs, ham, cheese, fruits, yogurt, etc.). We ended up being satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont you ever dare going there....”
Reviews.Author: Annarosa D
Reviews.Content: I had the worst experience in my life and I have been travelling for many years .I've stayed in the best hotels around the world but this was awful...It was not my choice because I had to stay there with a colleague on the way back from a business trip to Foggia. The only reason that my colleague had to chose this hotel is the location...its near the central train station..Anyway the stars that were given to this place are from another universe..!!! We arrived there late in the evening after a three hours journey by train...the man at the reception was very rude and ignorant...first he couln't find our booking and then he gave me a room which was so small and dark that I burst into tears...I went to the reception again crying and told him that I was not going to sleep in that room because I am a claustrophobic , but the other room he gave me was similar...My collegue was given a room on the ground floor which was cold and ..smelly...!! Anyway Thank God it was only for one night.....

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average and underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Woo78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in July. The service, while never rude, was not friendly or helpful, the room was very small, but clean, the bed was soft and two singles, the bathroom was poor (weak shower that went all over the floor. It was noisey in the morning, and the Internet was a rip off. I have nothing against it, but I know from my time in Rome that other hotels in the same location are more comfortable, friendlier and offer better value. Would I stay there again? No.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we stayed in all Europe! Service was the pits!”
Reviews.Author: Cam_rok
Reviews.Content: We booked online with wotif.com Checked in and had the worst service I have ever had all over the world! Rooms were not to bad but nothing to excite anyone! Location wasn't to bad either, real close to termini. But the way we were treated was Awful, one guy had to finish his Facebook message before I could ask him my question! Didn't feel welcome at all! This bad first impression of Rome tainted our whole Rome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: DahliaBlack
Reviews.Content: Fortunately for us we didn't stay here long. No free internet, no instructions on the safe, dripping water in the toilet all night. The walls are like paper, you can hear everything. It sounds like a train is coming down the steps when anyone walks past your room - if you have the misfortune of being near the stairwell. The breakfast room is in the basement..... and yes I could go on - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about but okay”
Reviews.Author: LemonadeJoe
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, good size and recently renovated. With a bit of the requisite Italian flair. Bathroom ditto. Unfortunately, the toilet did not flush properly and there was no warm water in the shower in the morning (for two days). Also, as always in Italy, the room was poorly sound-proofed. Location: near the central railways station, but in a nice street, not in one of the slightly dodgy ones. So, quite good for accessing most sights either on foot or taking the metro from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel , worst we stayed at in Italy”
Reviews.Author: priscoharley
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of a long trip through out Italy, Initially , they gave us a room that was so small that we could not open our suitcases, the next room on the top floor , the toliet did not work, the next room ,also on the top floor , was large but the beds were extremely hard and the shower did not drain. We stayed 3 nights and they did not fix the shower drain problem untill the last day and had to be called to clean the room . It was awfull and while you are close to the railway station , it does take a long time to get to the center of town and tourist sites. We were happy to leave . No other hotels we stayed in at the same price level were as bad as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible; avoid at all cost. Scam when booking with Hotel Select”
Reviews.Author: Batz
Reviews.Content: I had a room reserved at Hotel Select through hotels.com, and upon arrival at Hotel Select, I was advised that the hotel was overbooked, and that my reservation had been moved to their 'other hotel' down the street. This happened to be the Hotel Europa. A quick look at the tripadvisor reviews for these hotels will give you an idea of why you will be disappointed being dumped at the Hotel Europa. The room was tiny, the TV inoperative, and appeared to have been last decorated sometime in the 1960s. Also the evening staff was extremely rude, when I asked politely if they had an adapter plug I could use. They said, that no, they didn't, "at this moment" have one. When will you, I asked? This seemed to anger the desk manager, and when I asked if he could inquire at the Hotel Select to see if they had one, he became enraged, hateful, and rude. I thought it was a reasonable request given that I had paid about 100 euros for a room at a hotel that had a good reputation, and was instead dumped into hotel hell. I advise travelers to avoid the Hotel Europa at all costs, and to report the dumping practice of Hotel Select to all websites they possibly can.

Reviews.Title: “Indignation and treatment unworthy”
Reviews.Author: yoyor00
Reviews.Content: We arrived yesterday evening after a allday trip, we were very surprised that the Hotel Europa had apparently overbooking our rooms (3 rooms), indeed, they were none room disponible . In addition, the receptionist, instead to apologize, was very discourteous by not giving us any explanation and sending us to another hotel (without any information about the price, etc), which was, in his words, not very nice. We searched this hotel with our luggage, but we did not find it, the receptionist indications were blur. Then, we finally found another hotel, with some dificulties (it was late and we wanted three rooms) . We came back at the hotel Europa to prevent them of our situation and have a proof of the non avaibility of the rooms. The receptionist, who was since our arival upset and virula, was very rude, and he threatened to beat me ! Moreover, the receptionist did not want to give us a voucher for the non-avaibility of our rooms. After discuting, we obtainted one ... It is incredible to see that from a hotel of this class ...

Reviews.Title: “Top location and friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: maronan
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on a seven week travel through France and Italy.We arrived at the train station and only had to walk three streets down to the hotel (5 mins). On first inspection the room lacked a couple of things but after talking to Catarine and Julia these were put right. In fact nothing was too much trouble for any of the hotel staff and their English was much apreciated. The area feels safe and is in easy walking distance from trains,busses , shops and many of Romes attractions. The Hotel is very clean and the breakfast was the best that we had from the 12 hotels we stayed in.Everything that we had been offered at other hotels but here there was bacon and eggs! We will return here again but we would not be surprised if another star isn't added within the next year or so.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: FizzyLiftingDrinks
Reviews.Content: We began and ended our vacation in Rome. We booked Hotel Select for our last night in Rome, because it was near Termini. When we arrived at Hotel Select, we were promptly told that we were booked in one of their other hotels, Hotel Europa, two blocks down the street. My husband and I were confused and questioned the manager. He did not back down and showed us to Hotel Europa. We checked in and were directed to our room. It looked like it had been newly renovated…white dust on the tile floors, no shower curtain, a missing lock latch on the inside, and a broken air-conditioner. We went back to the front desk and explained our concerns. The manager sent a repairman within 5 minutes. He told us to let the A/C kick in and to give it 30 minutes. He did return quickly with a shower curtain and latch for the lock. After 60 minutes, the A/C had still not gotten cold. We returned to the front desk to ask for another room. This time, the manager was very curt with us, saying that there were only single rooms available. She could not help us. - We woke up early and left, not wanting to prolong our stay at this mediocre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europa - Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bighelsby
Reviews.Content: A fine old renovated hotel, with excellent service, located two minutes on foot from the train station. It's the prefect location from which to plan your tours, museum visits, etc. Internet and laundry services nearby. We were stranded in Rome recently due to the volcanic ash cloud flight cancellations. Roberto and Julia at the desk speak English and were extremely helpful. Rooms are comfortable and are kept very clean. Breakfast on site, is included and couldn't have been better. Great selection and plentiful….can almost keep you going until supper. Professional, friendly, caring staff. Bob and Helma Holmes

Reviews.Title: “Basic,but good!”
Reviews.Author: Deea13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic,but very clean and if you go to Rome just to get some rest in the night,this hotel is perfect. The location is very close to termini Station which is their main station. If you like to walk,you don't even need to take the bus or the metro to the main attractions,just to Vatican.... The breakfast was basic too,but it seems that richer then a normal italian breakfast...2 types of meat,1 type of cheese,eggs,croissants,bread,butter,jam,cereals,milk,coffee. The personal of the hotel speak english and they are nice!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl46
Reviews.Content: This place ruined our time in Rome. Was travelling with two other friends. Together we had two seperate rooms both of which on the first night we were bitten. My room was this horrible dark place where I felt like I was in a basement, the bathroom was broken and it smelt. On the second night we were moved to two new rooms (after complaining) and continued to be bitten. We demanded the mattresses be changed, which they were, but on the third night the biting continued. Complaints to management fell on deaf ears. On the final night I covered the mattress with a rainncoat in a bid to stop the bugs from getting to me- it seemed to work slightly as I was on bitten on the feet. Also on the final night the lavatory in my friends suite overflowed all over the floor with faeces. We were so glad to get out of the place. As we had prepaid for the rooms via Yeego.com we were not in a position to be able to leave and go to another hotel. The price was pretty high considering the value I received from Hotel Amalfi (Via Meraluna) in July 2007 which added insult to the injury. Breakfast was a depressing affair, the place was miserable. Do yourself a favour and avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “quirky faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: AudreyandJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the hotel europa. Once you overlooked the general shabbiness of the rooms the place grows on you Sister had to change rooms because of the smell coming from her room , avoid rm 306 Cousin had the infamous room in the attic but stayed in it because if the adequacy of the bathroom All in all not a bad hotel for the price , the mattresses were the best thing about the stay, perfect ! Staff lovely especially the man from Israel , who let us in each night On our first night , the receptionist told us that they were one room short so we had to move to a sister hotel down the road for a night , not bad but a little boxy. Perfect for what you need in rome , a place to lay your head after a days sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Is this the attic or is it my room?”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this hotel is rated a 3-stars. With the experience that I had, the only 3-stars that it has is the lobby, the reception area, I had better room in a 1 star in a third world motel. I was given room #405 upon check-in. To get to that room, you have to climb a narrow staircase all the way to the top, cross the hotel rooftop (no I am not kidding) and there it is. What I should describe as a shed that was probably was used to keep the pigeons in the old day. The door lock showed sign that it was probably kicked in at some point in the past. The sole single bed is tucked to the slanted ceiling that forced me to duck in order not to bang my head whenever I wanted to get something from the drawer. The bed was a simple mattress of dubious quality and I couldn't quite make out the color of the linen if it is white or yellow. I don't know whether I should laugh or cry when I opened the bathroom door. The decent shampoo and conditioner seems totally out of place. A good thing is the hot/cold water seems to work just fine. The wall so paper-thin, I can hear all the conversation from the room next door. Guess what they were talking about, they were trying to figure out a way to get out of this hotel. I was looking around a good excuse to get myself out of this hole myself but there were no cockroaches around for me to justifying getting myself that room at the Westin Excelsior. I have seem a lot of bad room around the world but at $130 USD/night, I expect something a bit more decent. Stay at your own risk!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Europa hotel”
Reviews.Author: bogies
Reviews.Content: I had booked to stay at this hotel with my boyfriend for a long weekend but after seeing some of the reviews we were both extremely dubious. However, I have to say we were more than pleasantly surprised. The hotel is clean, in an excellent location and the breakfast is more than adequate. The staff are extremely helpful and speak perfect english. It is alittle difficult to find at first but this can be easily overcome by getting a taxi (35 euro's from the airport). The beds are alittle hard but this is my only gripe. I would happily recommend anyone to stay here :-)

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JoneeHughes
Reviews.Content: The area around Termini station used to have a reputation for disreputable characters and iffy hotels. Not so in recent years – the station has cleaned up its act with some cool shopping, air-conditioned café-bars and even its own art gallery! The Hotel Europa is an excellent base from which to explore the city and get out of town on day trips by train (essential in the summer swelter we found). The staff are multi-lingual and really friendly and the hotel itself is well worth its 3 stars. The room was spacious, clean, the bed huge and the little details just right. I’m a regular traveller to Rome and this is one of the best value for money deals in town.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience is all this hotel offers”
Reviews.Author: maireha
Reviews.Content: The pictures represented for this hotel are SOMEWHERES ELSE. I didnt see a fountain or courtyard or pool. We had 2 "double" rooms. We crawled over the bed to get to the bathroom. If your luggage was in the way, you were in trouble. It is, however, very convenient to the main train station, Termini, which also has a place to catch the bus to anywhere in the city. The staff was friendly and helpful, but unless you get up early, forget coffee...you must walk down the block. (Try getting up early after travelling 2 days and losing 6 hours.) No amenities, just a place to lay your head on a hard "bed".

Reviews.Title: “Handy but terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: nowfindadam
Reviews.Content: First up, you have to throw away your NZ/Aus/US/Canadian idea of service before staying in a European hotel. They have totally different ideas. Our room was dark, but clean. The bathroom on the scummy side and tiny, but hygenic I guess. The matresses on the beds were really thin, about half the size of a normal mattress and very hard, but this is pretty normal for Hotels in this price range in Italy. The good thing about this hotel is the location. It's only 2 blocks walk from the main train station (Termini), the South African girl (who speaks perfect english) at the front desk is really helpful and there is a laundry/internet cafe across the road. I'd stay here again, after experiencing 3 more weeks in Italy and getting used to their idea of 'service'.

Reviews.Title: “small dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I woul not stay here again!! Rooms are amall and dirty! Breakfast is terrible. It's not worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great either!”
Reviews.Author: Spurano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 2 to 3 minutes walk from the main station in Rome - Termini Station. An Easy Jet bus called Terravision took us straight to the station from Campiano airport for a small fee (buy a return ticket there and then if you can). All the streets in this area are in a grid system with dozens and dozens of hotels so make sure you have an accurate map to find the hotel. The entrance has a large canopy over it which may help you find it easier. Night time around Termini can be slightly unsavoury - drunks, down and outs etc. but don't let that put you off as the hotel, although close to the station, does not suffer from these problems. Staff on the whole were friendly although one male receptionist would scarcely look at us. I think he may be in the wrong job! Night receptionist could not explain to us how to use our hotel room safe. He gave us instructions in Italian but that didn't really help. Room was fine. Adequate size, clean and comfortable. Colour TV and air conditioning worked well. No shower curtain in the bathroom which meant the bathroom flooded every time the shower was used. This may be an Italian thing as I've heard this elsewhere. Breakfast room was not too inspiring (set in the basement with no natural light) and selection of food not great but adequate. Although you can walk to a lot of sights from the hotel it is downhill most of the way which means its uphill on the way back up! I'm fit but the combination of the heat and walking can be a real killer. If you're going in the summer I strongly recommend using the buses or metro. You can buy an all day city ticket for both for about £2 or £3. Bargain. Get these at the wee shops out the front of Termini at the end of the covered walkway. The guys in these will tell you what number to take. Just a word of warning about the metro underground. It officially shuts at 11.30pm but that depends where you are on the network. I would use 10.45pm at the latest as a guide if you want to get back to Termini. Please be very careful crossing the streets. I know someone who was knocked down the first time he crossed a street outside Termini. Saw pickpockets in action as well at the Pantheon. Use a rucksack with padlocks! Also don't be fooled by guys dressed as Gladiators etc. at the main sights. They'll charge 20 Euros for taking a photo of you with your own camera. You've been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Average, but good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rather small room, just enough space to walk halfway around the bed. There's a desk, minibar, and cupboard. Bathroom was clean, but the heater was broken. Room heater was working fine. Breakfast was good, standard ham, salami, cheese and bread.. great cappucino. Very nicely decorated breakfast room. Very good location, just a couple blocks from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenner_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a holiday at last minute on the internet and our decision was partly influenced by the fact that we got a cheap holiday and the Hotel was situated within a four mile radius of all the things that we wanted to see in Rome: the Colosseum , Roman Fort, the Vatican and Trevi Fountain. However, it was in a working class district and near the main railway station. We didn't find this a negative factor as it was three streets back and the numerous shops in Termini became a positive. (The latter had three levels of shopping and surprisingly it had Mango, United Colours of Benetton , Nike and loads of perfumeries and eating places. The Carbineiri and the clergy ate there and it is a bussling place ). The Hotel was very clean and a the staff were multi-lingual and helpful. It is basic and a two star plus in our opinion. The staff are so friendly that I definitely would go back here. I'd give it 6/10. It costs 50 Euros for a taxi ( single trip ) from the airport to the Hotel and if you telephone the Hotel well beforehand then they will arrange this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It is 2 blocks fromthe center of Taranto,Italy (Puglia) with a view ofthe sea. It has shopping, resturants,and local bus (1.00 Euro) within 2 blocks of the hotel; also breakfastis included (fruit,danish,milk,juice,coffe,tea,and cereal).The decor of the hotelis art deco.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Europa
HotelInfo.Address: Via Varese 26, 00185 Rome, Italy
